logs_dashboards_description: Dashboards are graphic representations of your logs. With a variety of available modules (line charts, pie charts, counters, statistics, etc.), you get a broad overview of your data. How many errors have occurred in the last 24 hours? Are they increasing, or decreasing? Which page was visited the most today? How many customers visited this month? You can access all of this information straight away. With a range of dashboards, you can display data according to precise contexts, and make the information as easily readable as possible.
logs_dashboards_delete_message: Are you sure you want to delete the {{ dashboardName }} dashboard?
logs_dashboards_select_stream_title: Attach all modules in the new dashboard to the following data stream (optional):

logs_welcome_title: Logs Data Platform is a logs management system, designed by OVH
logs_welcome_description_1: Index and analyse logs in real time. Receive alerts if anything stops working. Share your data with your employees.
logs_welcome_description_2: The Logs Data Platform is a comprehensive platform for you and your company to manage and analyse logs. Get an overview of the behaviour of your virtual and physical servers. Get an understanding of the behaviour of your cloud-based and mobile applications. Anticipate incidents in advance, and receive alerts if anything stops working.
logs_accounts_description: The Logs Data Platform is a comprehensive platform for you and your company to manage and analyse logs. Get an overview of the behaviour of your virtual and physical servers. Get an understanding of the behaviour of your cloud-based and mobile applications. Anticipate incidents in advance, and receive alerts if anything stops working.

logs_home_info: The Logs Data Platform is an interface for collecting, indexing and analysing logs. Wherever your logs come from, you can use the platform to choose different entry points depending on the protocol, security level and format. You can analyse and use data with a variety of different APIs and web interfaces.

logs_home_shortcuts_elasticsearch_help: You need to have an alias or index to access the Elasticsearch API.

logs_tokens_description: To enable access to your logs for external applications, or to automate certain tasks, you will need to give them access to APIs. The most secure way of managing this access is via authentication tokens. This feature means you no longer need to enter your login details in configuration files.

logs_streams_description: With streams, you can direct your logs to a specific category in real time, as soon as they arrive in the Logs Data Platform. If you have several streams, you can also easily categorise them in real time depending on their source, the application, or the source server — and you can also create confidentiality levels depending on the streams, which means you distribute your access to authorised people only. The tokens here are write tokens, which enable you to ensure that logs are sent via the right streams. Generally, having a number of different streams is a huge help when it comes to searching for your logs. You no longer need to exclude the results of another system or application.

streams_alerts_current_title: Manage your alerts for the {{ name }} data stream
streams_alerts_intro_text: Once you have set up alert conditions, you no longer need to monitor your logs — the platform will do it for you. A number of different circumstances are liable to trigger an alert, which will then be sent to you by email: a lack of messages from a specific software application for an unusually long time, if the number of tasks carried out is unusually low, if traffic on your website is very high, or if certain keywords in particular appear on your stream.
streams_alerts_delete_message: Are you sure you want to delete the {{alert}} alert?
streams_alerts_delete_error: An error has occurred when deleting the {{alertName}} alert: {{message}}
streams_alerts_condition_message_count: The alert is triggered when there have been {{thresholdType}} than {{threshold}} message(s) in the last {{time}} minutes. The {{queryFilter}} filter is applied, and {{backlog}} messages will be included in the notification.
streams_alerts_condition_field_value: The alert is triggered when the {{field}} field has had a value {{thresholdType}} {{constraintType}} than {{threshold}} in the last {{time}} minutes. The {{queryFilter}} filter is applied, and {{backlog}} messages will be included in the notification.
streams_alerts_condition_field_content_v: The alert is triggered when a message containing the {{field}} field with the "{{value}}" value is received. The {{queryFilter}} filter is applied, and {{backlog}} messages will be included in the notification.
create_alert: Create an alert with the following as a condition
add_alert_description_message_count: This condition is triggered when the number of messages is higher or lower than the defined threshold for a given period.
add_alert_description_field_value: This condition is triggered when the aggregate value for a field is higher or lower than a defined threshold over a given period.
add_alert_description_field_content_valu: This condition is activated when the content of the messages equals a defined value.
add_alert_time_period_field_description: Evaluate the condition for all messages received within the given number of minutes.
add_alert_threshold_type_field_descripti: Select the condition that will trigger the alert, e.g. more/fewer messages than the threshold.
Select the condition that will trigger the alert, e.g. when the value is higher/lower than the threshold.
add_alert_threshold_field_description: The value that triggers the alert if it is exceeded.
add_alert_grace_period_field_description: The number of minutes to wait after an alert has been resolved before re-issuing an alert.
add_alert_accumulation_field_description: The number of messages to include in the alert notifications.
add_alert_notification_field_description: Tick this box to send notifications every time the condition for the alert is met, regardless of the alert's status.
add_alert_field_field_description: Name of the field to be checked.
add_alert_constraint_type_field_descript: Select the statistic function to use in this aggregation
add_alert_value_query_filter_description: Search criteria to apply to filter messages from this traffic.
add_alert_value_field_description: The value to be compared against the field's value.

inputs_intro_text: Data-gathering tools are software programs that are used to gather logs from servers and applications. It provides an efficient way of processing and transforming logs into GELF files, which are compatible with the Logs Data Platform. You no longer need to dedicate hardware resources, or monitor the availability of your infrastructures — we do it for you. You can use this platform to link these tools to different streams for simple, secure configuration with firewall rules.

inputs_logs_configure_logstash_desc2: Once you have edited these sections, you can test your configuration directly.

input_logs_configure_delimiter_tooltip_S: Message size prefix, as specified in RFC 5425. However, line returns also act as delimiters, to collect corrupt or invalid inputs.

logs_index_description: With Logs Data Platform, you can create and host Elasticsearch indexes. These can be used for the configuration data of a Kibana instance, indexing statistical data, or enriching and correlating your logs. You can then use these indexes with the majority of tools and applications that are compatible with the Elasticsearch REST API.

logs_aliases_description: Tap into the full potential of Elasticsearch by creating an alias on your logs or indexes. This will give you access to more complex requests, such as nested aggregations, and will unlock compatibility with the most popular tools on the market.
